@timfeirg, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @bolkedebruin and @jlowin to be potential reviewers.

I think this needs reverting as it _impossible_ to include an argument with an embedded space!

I don't think this is needed:

```
application="com.example.MyClass"
args=[
  "--foo=bar",
 "--qux=foo bar",
]
task = SparkSubmitOperator(
    task_id="spark_csv_parser",
    dag=dag,
    application="com-example-spark.jar",
    application_args=args,
    java_class="com.example.MyClass",
)
```

Previously to this PR this would do the equivalent of:

```py
popen([
  "spark-submit",
  ...,
  "com-example-spark.jar",
  "com.example.MyClass",
  "--foo=bar",
  "--qux=foo bar"
])
```

But after this commit it drastically changes the last argument:

```py
popen([
  "spark-submit",
  ...,
  "com-example-spark.jar",
  "com.example.MyClass",
  "--foo=bar",
  "--qux=foo",
  "bar"
])
```

Hi @mistercrunch,

Thanks for the feedback. I'm not changing the behaviour of the`hive_to_druid.py` operator. The only thing I'm doing is extracting the [specific config](https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/master/airflow/hooks/druid_hook.py#L91-L141) that is related to hive from the operator.

My main issue is that the current way of supplying the configuration is not really flexible, for example, it would require a lot of changes, and adding a lot of extra arguments to let the operator work with [Druid Parquet ingestion](http://druid.io/docs/latest/development/extensions-contrib/parquet.html).

The idea is to change the current Druid hook, and make it more flexible. Don't change the API of the hive-to-druid operator and add an extra druid operator which is more flexible and not directly interlinked with Hive. This one can be used to ingest from a hdfs directory.

Let me know what you think.

Cheers, Fokko
